mainmatter.p: A scheme is a locally ringed space with an open covering on which the space is isomorphic to affine schemes.
An affine scheme is a locally ringed space of the form \operatorname {Spec} (R)Spec⁡(R)\operatorname {Spec} (R)Spec(R) for some commutative ring RRRR.

Given a ringed space, i.e. a space XXXX with a sheaf of rings \mathscr { O }O\mathscr { O }O, it is said to be locally ringed iff the following conditions hold: If \Gamma (U, \mathscr { O } ) = 0Γ(U,O)=0\Gamma (U, \mathscr { O } ) = 0Γ(U,O)=0, then UUUU is empty. Suppose f + g \in \Gamma (U, \mathscr { O } )f+g∈Γ(U,O)f + g \in \Gamma (U, \mathscr { O } )f+g∈Γ(U,O) is invertible, then we can cover UUUU with two open sets such that ffff and gggg are invertible when restricted respectively. This can be unified as one condition: If a finite sum in \Gamma (U, \mathscr { O } )Γ(U,O)\Gamma (U, \mathscr { O } )Γ(U,O) is invertible, then each summand is invertible when restricted to an open, which jointly covers UUUU.

frontmatter.title: Structure sheaf of \operatorname {Proj} (S)Proj⁡(S)\operatorname {Proj} (S)Proj(S)

mainmatter.p: Fix a graded ring SSSS. For a positively graded element ffff, we have a graded ring localization S[f^{-1}]_ \bulletS[f−1]∙S[f^{-1}]_ \bulletS[f−1]∙​. Let \Gamma (D_+(f), \mathscr { O } )Γ(D+(f),O)\Gamma (D_+(f), \mathscr { O } )Γ(D+​(f),O) be the zeroth degree component S[f^{-1}]_0S[f−1]0S[f^{-1}]_0S[f−1]0​. This defines a sheaf over the projective spectrum, and moreover gives a scheme \operatorname {Proj} (S)Proj⁡(S)\operatorname {Proj} (S)Proj(S).

We claim that \operatorname {Proj} (S)Proj⁡(S)\operatorname {Proj} (S)Proj(S) can alternatively be given by gluing affine schemes. We assign D_+ (f)D+(f)D_+ (f)D+​(f) the affine scheme \operatorname {Spec} (S[f^{-1}]_0)Spec⁡(S[f−1]0)\operatorname {Spec} (S[f^{-1}]_0)Spec(S[f−1]0​) (which is possible because the open subspace D_+ (f)D+(f)D_+ (f)D+​(f) is homeomorphic to \operatorname {Spec} (S[f^{-1}]_0)Spec⁡(S[f−1]0)\operatorname {Spec} (S[f^{-1}]_0)Spec(S[f−1]0​) as a space). Given two positively graded elements ffff and gggg, we have an isomorphism between \operatorname {Proj} (S)Proj⁡(S)\operatorname {Proj} (S)Proj(S) restricted to D_+ (f g)D+(fg)D_+ (f g)D+​(fg) and \operatorname {Spec} (S[f^{-1}]_0)Spec⁡(S[f−1]0)\operatorname {Spec} (S[f^{-1}]_0)Spec(S[f−1]0​) restricted to D(g^{ \deg f}/f^{ \deg g})D(gdeg⁡f/fdeg⁡g)D(g^{ \deg f}/f^{ \deg g})D(gdegf/fdegg), given by the obvious ring isomorphism. We can verify that this satisfies the cocycle condition, and hence defines a scheme.
